page.title: 01Munslow to Tusford Lowland
page.content: The block contains undulating valley land around the small river Corve and the Tingford and Pye brooks plus the steep slopes to the Heath plateau. Munslow village (population 128) still has its 'Hundred House', now an inn - The Crown. The rest of the population live in the hamlet of Tingford, Bouldon & Broncroft, the settlement of Heath & Bancott plus isolated farms, houses & cottages. Agriculture is the dominant occupation, but a substantial number of people commute to work elsewhere. Retired persons are numerous but there are few unemployed. Rich red soil supports pastures for fattening cattle & sheep. There are only two modest dairy herds. However, the majority of fields are cropped with cereals & occasionally oilseed rape, peas & potatoes. Blackcurrants are grown at Bancott Farm.
